fields.text:
Flexible, scalable and secure
-------------------------------------------------

* Customisable and flexible to support any funding process
* Fully cloud-based solution to scale to your needs
* Data security and ownership means no privacy concerns

Save time and minimise stress
-------------------------

* Reduce time taken to administer and assess applications for funding
* No more searching for updated spreadsheets, documents or e-mails

Creating Start-Up Success
View more presentations from Alexander Osterwalder.

Powering business plan competitions, grant proposals and early-stage funding

------------------------------ * Full integrated solution for existing funding processes and workflows * Excellent user design built with ease-of-use in mind

When you first signed up for this competition we should have sent you an email with a link to your saved application. 

If you don't have that message, enter your email below and we'll send you another reminder.
We send the link through email instead of just showing it to you to help keep your application private.

We run business plan competitions better than anyone else*
*Don’t believe us, take a [free trial](/dashboard/new_comp/ "Take a free trial!")
<iframe title="YouTube video player" class="youtube-player" type="text/html" width="280" height="200" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/FWRgZU13bvQ" frameborder="0"></iframe>

#What is NVANA? NVANA is about building tools to support the teaching, mentoring and funding of entrepreneurs. Simple as that! #Who are you guys?
 
![Photo of Rob](http://a0.twimg.com/profile_images/431662267/rob_bigger.jpg)
##Rob Fitzpatrick Rob's previous startup Habit Industries was backed by Y Combinator, he mentors at Seedcamp, built The Startup Toolkit and studied CS at Georgia Tech. He also organises Startup Poker.
 
![Photo of Tom](http://a1.twimg.com/profile_images/1177082391/photo_bigger.jpg)
##Thomas Stone Tom is studying for his PhD at UCL. He's had a couple of prior startups, is an advisor at NACUE, Chairman of UCL Enterprise Society, previously helped out at Seedcamp, studied at Cornell University, London Business School, London School of Economics and University of Birmingham. He is also a Fellow of the RSA.
 
We also have some pretty fantastic advisors who we'll be announcing in due course. #So what's the inspiration for NVANA? Why not check out our first [blog post](/flat/Blog "Check out our blog...").

#Contact us

Got something interesting to say, perhaps some feedback, a question, or anything else for that matter, then get in touch!

Just send an e-mail to <contact@nvana.com> and we'll get back to you right away.

Terms of service
=======================

Your security is of the utmost importance. As such, if you would like to use NVANA and have any queries regarding the following terms please let us know by emailing <contact@nvana.com>.

We have tried our best to keep this a clean and simple as possible whilst protecting both our service and most importantly our users.

##Definitions

The website at http://nvana.com ("Service")

The owners & operators of the Service ("We", "Us", "Our", "NVANA")

Anything you type in or upload to the Service ("Data")

##Data

* Your data is yours. We can't use it, analyze it, or share it beyond what is required for us to run the Service unless you explicitly say otherwise.
* You can permanently delete your account and all associated Data by emailing <contact@nvana.com>. Your Data will be removed from the live site & databases within two working days. It will continue to exist in backups for no more than 30 days, after which time every trace of it is gone forever.
* Your Data is backed up daily to multiple locations. In the event of catastrophic Service failure, you should lose less than 36 hours data.
* If we cancel your account for any reason that is outside your control, we will send a copy of your Data to the email you signed up with.

##Your account, payments, & use of the Service

* If we feel you are using the service to break any law or are abusing the service, we may disable your account and canvases.
* The service is provided "as-is" and you use it at your own risk
* Sometimes the site will be down or unavailable. We aren't responsible for any damage caused by the site failing.
* You may cancel your account at any time by emailing <contact@nvana.com>.

In the case that you're paying to use NVANA as a service, the following also apply:

* The service bills in advance at the start of each monthly cycle.
* If you have a paid account and we are unable to receive your payments, your account will be disabled.
* You won't be billed again after cancelling your account.
* We're allowed to change the pricing plans with 30 days notice.

##User agreement

By using NVANA you are agreeing to the following:

* You are at least 13 years old.
* You signed up with a valid email which you have access to.
* You are responsible for maintaining the privacy & security of your login credentials.
* You are responsible for whatever happens on the Service under your account.
* You won't use the service for illegal or inappropriate purposes, including (but not limited to!) posting content that violates copyright or IP laws or contains another company's trade secrets.

##Meta

* We're allowed to change these terms. If we do so, the latest version will be found at http://nvana.com/terms. By using the site, you agree to the current terms of service.
* Violation of the terms will lead to the cancellation of your account
* You expressly understand and agree that We shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential or exemplary damages, including but not limited to, damages for loss of profits, goodwill, use, trade secrets, data or other intangible losses (even if We has been advised of the possibility of such damages), resulting from: (i) the use or the inability to use the service; (ii) the cost of procurement of substitute goods and services resulting from any goods, data, information or services purchased or obtained or messages received or transactions entered into through or from the service; (iii) unauthorized access to or alteration of your transmissions or data; (iv) statements or conduct of any third party on the service; (v) or any other matter relating to the service.
* Our failure to exercise or enforce any right or provision of the Terms of Service shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision. The Terms of Service constitutes the entire agreement between you and Us and govern your use of the Service, superceding any prior agreements between you and Us (including, but not limited to, any prior versions of the Terms of Service).

##Questions

Any questions about the Terms of Service should be sent to <contact@nvana.com>.

#In the beginning... First and foremost, people are going to ask how you pronounce "NVANA"? Is it "Nir-va-na" like the band or Buddhist ideal or "N-vana" like the yellow bendy fruit?! We'll let you decide. Any way we're certainly not the Nevada Association of Nurse Anesthetists! NVANA was founded out of a belief that entrepreneurs are important, really important. Given this belief, we want to build tools to teach, mentor & fund entrepreneurs. Our plan is to work with the best in teaching, mentoring and funding and help them do what they do even better. Think [Steve Blank](http://steveblank.com/ "Steve Blank's blog"), [Seedcamp](http://seedcamp.com/ "Seedcamp's website")...etc. etc. We want to help spread best practice around the world. Our first "app" (apparently everything is an "app" these days) is a tool to power competitions. More specifically business plan competitions, you'll soon hear a lot more about [business model competitions](http://www.businessmodelcompetition.com/ "BYU's Business Model Competition website"). In this endeavour we've been lucky enough to work with the [London Entrepreneurs' Challenge](http://www.londonentrepreneurschallenge.com/ "London Entrepreneurs' Challenge website") (commonly referred to as E Challenge) in supporting over 500 student entrepreneurs. So why are we doing this? Two reasons in particular: * Entrepreneurship education is, by and large, missing the point [1] * Entrepreneurs fail for stupid reasons [2] We think both of these issues are resolvable and we think the best way to achieve this with any real impact is by providing tools to entrepreneurs via educators, business plan competitions, seed accelerators and the like. First in Europe and then the rest of the world. We hope you share our ambitions and aspirations, if so feel free to [get in touch](http://www.nvana.com/contact "Contact us"). More importantly, watch this space! ##Key points * Entrepreneurs are important * Entrepreneurship education misses the mark & entrepreneurs fail for stupid reasons * NVANA is dedicated to building tools to support the teaching, mentoring and funding of entrepreneurs
[1] Not everywhere obviously, [Stanford University](http://stvp.stanford.edu/ "Stanford Technology Ventures Program website") and others can and should hold their heads up high as evidence of that. But in the words of [NACUE](http://www.nacue.com "NACUE's website") "The quality of entrepreneurship education is disparate and unequal..." [2] It's true! By "stupid" we mean "easily avoidable".

NVANA powers the London Entrepreneurs Challenge and allows us to focus more on supporting student entrepreneurs instead of worrying about administrative issues...

fields.default_text:
Your pitch has been received. Thanks for applying and good luck!

We'll keep you in the loop via email as the competition progresses.

You can edit your application until judging begins by returning to this webpage, which is linked in the first email we sent you.
fields.tooltip:
This message is shown to applicants on-screen after they've submitted the first version of their pitch.

It should tell them that their pitch has been received and they're officially in the contest.
fields.title: thanks for applying
